events.name: Community Technology Update 2016
events.description: We are back again with Community Technology Update 2016.There will be 3 tracks this year - IoT Track, Developer Track and IT Professional Track. Session title can be found below. You can find out more information at http://ctu2016.azurewebsites.net/ Please register yourself at http://bit.ly/RegisterCTU2016 and stand a chance to bring home a FREE CTU T-shirt. You must be registered and be the first 100 to turn up on the actual day to get your T-Shirt (Sizes While Stock Last) We will be constantly updating the site with more information so keep a look out!
events.location: Microsoft Auditorium (Singapore), One Marina Boulevard, Level 21 Auditorium, Singapore 018989

events.name: Humla Workshop - Mobile App Penetration Testing - Android + iOS - Part 1
events.description:
We are pleased to inform Humla Hands-On workshop on Android App pentesting by Srinivas Rao K.  Please note, this is an invite only but FREE  hands-on workshop, we can accommodate only few selected participants. If you get selected, you will receive email from humla champion by 10th September 2016. *** We are looking for more speakers to contribute to this series. Please get in touch if you are interested.  Selection Criteria: Selection (15-20 persons only) will be based on the following two criteria: 1. Contribution to the community. Speakers, humla, bachav champions, core team, volunteers  and venue hosts will get priority to the workshop.  2. Passion towards Information security + the attendance in previous meet ups.   If you are new to the community, selection will be based on the answers to the survey questions asked during the registration process. Please answer these questions carefully.  Agenda:  As part of the Mobile App Pentesting Series, Part 1 , we will cover the following topics: 1. Introduction to Android Security model  2. Difference between Static Analysis and Dynamic Analysis 3. Do black box and grey box assessment on android applications.  4. Latest tools of the trade.  


Pre-requisites: Should have done web application pen testing before, using burp. 


Who should attend ? :  Anyone who is interested in Android Security, Android Mobile App Pentesting and Research. 


What should I bring with me? : Hardware: Laptop which can run two VMs simultaneously with at least 4 GB RAM and minimum 30 GB hard disk free space. Software:   1. VMware Player Installed with Santoku Linux https://santoku-linux.com/ 2. Follow the instructions here and install everything as per the instructions including android studio, apktool, Drozer, and genymotion  3. Physical rooted device will be much preferred.  3. More instructions will be sent via email.  


Null humla champion: Srinivasa Rao Kotipalli is an OSCP (@srini0x00) works as a Security Engineer. Srinivas has extensive hands-on experience performing Web Application, Infrastructure and Mobile Security Assessments. He blogs at www.androidpentesting.com Please reach out to humla champion, if you have any questions regarding the event.
events.group_name: Null Singapore - The Open Security Community

events.name: workshop 3 [Beginner]
events.description: Hey everyone, we'll be having a 4 weeks workshop (every Saturday) on the basics of web programming that covers HTML, CSS, PHP and Javascript. This programming workshop is meant for beginners who have zero experience and touch with any programming languages at all, and is interested to learn more about the web. Not only will you learn coding skills, you'll also learn essential programming concepts that will help build your core fundamentals and help you become a great programmer. Throughout the workshop lessons, you'll learn to build an eCommerce website and by the end of it, you'll have a fully fledged eCommerce site deployed on the web. All the workshops are free of charge (gratis) and will be recorded. Feel free to stay after the workshop and ask us technical questions regarding any projects you have. For the second lesson, we will be covering: • PHP Part 2 • Javascript Part 1 Light refreshments and snacks will be provided. Timing 11AM to 4PM Venue Ngee Ann Polytechnic, LT 73C. Things To Bring • Laptop • Laptop Charger • Github Account (github.com) • Codeanywhere Account (Codeanywhere.com)
events.location: Ngee Ann Polytechnic, 535 Clementi Road, Singapore 599489

events.name: JavaScript & Interactive Apps - Hackerschool
events.description:
Web browsers are everywhere, and so is JavaScript, a dynamic programming language that browsers implement. We will be covering the basics of JavaScript and how to use it to control and add complex behaviour to web pages. 

In the process, we'll go through the development of an interactive web application. Remember to bring you own laptops!!

Sign up now for this free workshop @ http://school.nushackers.org/
events.location: Seminar Room 1-4, Town Plaza (Level 2), University Town, National University of Singapore,

events.name: EML Plugin | Mid-Autumn Party!
events.description:
The Electronic Music Lab Plugin is a series of social events held just outside our Studio where we listen to new works and works in progress while we chill around a BBQ late into the night!

This Plugin will be EXTRA special since it coincides with the Mid-Autumn Festival! There will be mooncakes, lanterns and sparklers!

Feel free to bring your own food and drinks to share!
